title: A Panorama of Rivers and Mountains
creator: Wang Ximeng
description: On April 1113, during Northern Song Dynasty, an 18 years old young artist Wang Ximeng finished one of the landscape painting masterpieces entitled "A Panorama of Rivers and Mountains." Different from traditional ink painting during the time, this handscroll is 51.5 x 1191.5cm. Wang Ximeng not only utilizes different perspectives in the extensive handscroll but also applies a combination of azurite blue and malachite green colors. Using multiple perspectives, the artist presents a continuous mountain landscape with dedicated details, such as bridges, houses, and boats. The inscription in the handscroll written by Cai Jing( 1047-1126), the prime minister in Huizong's court, conveys the artist's name as Ximeng and the artist's relationship with Emperor Huizong.
subject: Song Dynasty;Hand-scroll

title: Returning Boat on a Snowy River
creator: Emperor Huizong，Zhao Ji
description: This is a handscroll by the Song dynasty emperor Huizong, also known as Zhao Ji, which depicts the landscape with rivers and mountains after snow. There is a seal on the lore left corner with a pictorial signature. Even though the handscroll is not a blue and green color landscape painting, the composition and artist practices showcase characteristics of long handscroll Song court paintings. Besides, it also showcases how Emperor Huizong influenced Wang Ximeng's techniques in his blue and green color landscape painting A Panorama of Rivers and Mountains.
subject: Song Dynasty; Hand-scroll

title: Autumn Colors along Rivers and Mountains
creator: Zhao Boju
description: This handscroll is another 'blue and green landscape" example during Song Dynasty. The artist Zhao Boju depicts a mountain scenery with temples, bridges, and cottages. The bamboos, pinewoods, and washed dark blue and green pigments are well-arranged to show vivid details.
subject: Song Dynasty;Hand-scroll

title: Spring Excursion
creator: Zhan Ziqian
description: The Sui dynasty painter Zhan Ziqian, to whom this work has traditionally been attributed, depicts a view of a spring landscape among hills and watersides. The artist applied thin and thick lines to illustrate the outlines of rocks and trees. The artist vividly represents the appealing early spring landscape by using mineral pigments, such as malachite green and azurite blue.
subject: Sui Dynasty;Hand-scroll

title: Autumn Colors on the Que and Hua Mountains
creator: Zhao Mengfu
description: This scroll was by Yuan Dynasty painter Zhao Mengfu. The artist depicts two mountains landscape in the center. There are details showing fishers at work and winding waters with trees and cottages between the mountains. Blue and green coloring was added to the hills and shoals. There are also ochre and red color on the leaves to show the autumn atmosphere.
subject: Yuan Dynasty;Hand-scroll
